questions.text: Why couldn't Nightcrawler teleport Heather Hudson?
questions.correct: The Guardian suit had an electro-magnetic field
options: The Guardian suit was too heavy
The Guardian suit was not organic
questions.explanation:
The Guardian suit had an electro-magnetic field.

	The electro-magnetic field wreaked havoc with Nightcrawler's powers, causing him incredible amounts of pain. When Heather flew to Massachusetts to get training from Wolverine, Magneto attacked her and knocked her out in midair.

questions.text: While battling Ranark the Ravager, James MacDonald Hudson was able to catch two vehicles in the graviton beam in the Guardian suit. One vehicle was a sedan, but what was the other one?
questions.explanation:
A bus.

	This took place in "Marvel Two-In-One" #84. This was the first time the graviton beam was used, and to good measure! Ranark was eventually defeated thanks to Alpha Flight.

questions.text: In his first appearance, whom does James MacDonald Hudson beat?
questions.explanation:
Wolverine.

	Although still new at super-heroics, Guardian was able to easily subdue Wolverine, one of the fiercest hand-to-hand combatants in the Marvel universe.

questions.text: Hudson developed his first armored suit for what company?
questions.explanation:
Am-Can Petroleum Corporation.

	Used for geological purposes, the suit was controlled using a helmet that "Mac" had developed while still in college. Learning that it was going to be sold to an American corporation for military uses, he stole the suit and destroyed the blueprints.

questions.text: In the 108th issue of "Alpha Flight", does Heather need an underwater suit?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The Guardian suit can withstand the ocean depths, so all Heather needs is a mask in order to breathe oxygen. This took place when Alpha Flight sought to stop Attuma.

questions.text: Hudson seemingly died saving billions of people from Galactus. Under which name did he make his return?
questions.explanation:
Anti-Guard.

	Although Hudson has used both Weapon Alpha and Vindicator as code names, he made his return from seemingly sacrificing himself under the name Anti-Guard. He transported Galactus to a far-off location in issue 100 of "Alpha Flight" and returned twenty-nine issues later.

questions.text: The original Guardian suit used electromagnetic energy, but Heather Hudson used a suit that drew its power from geothermal energies.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Heather Hudson lead Alpha Flight for a longer period of time than her husband did, and without her leadership, the team would have surely fallen apart after "Mac"'s apparent death.

questions.text: The third person to don the Guardian armor is a clone of James MacDonald Hudson. How old is the clone?
questions.explanation:
19.

	To hide the fact that he was a clone, Department H told him that they had used time-warping technology on him after he suffered enormous injuries following a battle with Wolverine.

questions.text: The third person to don the Guardian suit died fighting which evil group?
questions.explanation:
A.I.M.

	Guardian III used an AIM battle-suit to fight his way to freedom, but the suit had taken a lot of damage by that time and it exploded, killing the younger James MacDonald Hudson.

questions.text: How much can James MacDonald Hudson lift when wearing the Guardian armor?
questions.explanation:
3.5 tons

	This fact, along with the array of weapons that can be used in many different ways, makes the Guardian armor one of the more deadly in the Marvel Universe. It also enables flight, as well as enhanced computer hacking skills.
